ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course! I would absolutely recommend it to anyone who wants a firm foundation in the history of science or intellectual history.
Its a very interesting survey of the social, philosophical, and scientific conditions that make up the so called Scientific Revolution. The class is broad, engaging, and worth the time.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Thanks for a great course! I really enjoyed our additional graduate student meetings and thought that giving feedback on each others' papers was a really helpful exercise. I didn't like Bruce Moran's Distilling Alchemy (in my opinion it doesn't do anything particularly well, and the content was totally unmemorable), but the other texts were great and provided an excellent foundation for thinking about the history of science.
